recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. 2. Cook bacon in a pan until crispy. 3. In a bowl, whisk eggs, Parmesan cheese, and black pepper. 4. Drain spaghetti and toss it with the bacon. 5. Remove from heat and mix in the egg mixture. 6. Serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C). 2. Roll out the pizza dough and place it on a baking sheet. 3. Spread tomato sauce over the dough. 4. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the sauce. 5. Top with fresh basil leaves. 6. Drizzle with olive oil. 7. Bake in the oven for 12-15 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is melted. 8. Slice and serve.

1. Dip ladyfingers in espresso and arrange them in a dish. 2. In a bowl, mix mascarpone cheese, eggs, and sugar until creamy. 3. Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. 4. Repeat with another layer of ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture. 5. Dust the top with cocoa powder. 6. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

1. Sauté finely chopped onion in a pan. 2. Add rice and toast for a few minutes. 3. Pour in white wine and let it evaporate. 4. Add ladles of hot vegetable broth gradually, stirring continuously. 5. Dissolve saffron in a bit of broth and add it to the risotto. 6. When the rice is al dente, remove from heat and stir in grated Parmesan cheese. 7. Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

1. Slice the baguette into thick slices and toast them. 2. Rub each slice with garlic. 3. Dice the tomatoes and mix them with chopped fresh basil. 4. Drizzle olive oil over the tomato mixture. 5. Spoon the tomato mixture onto the toasted bread slices. 6. Serve as an appetizer or snack.

1. Heat cream and sugar in a saucepan until hot, but not boiling. 2. Remove from heat and stir in soaked gelatin. 3. Add vanilla extract and mix well. 4. Pour the mixture into individual molds or glasses. 5. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours until set. 6. Serve with fruit sauce on top.

1. Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions. 2. In a pan, brown ground beef with chopped onion and garlic. 3. Add tomato sauce and simmer for a few minutes. 4. In a baking dish, layer noodles, meat sauce, and grated cheese. 5. Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used. 6. Bake in the oven at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes. 7. Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

1. Sauté chopped onion, carrots, celery, and zucchini in a pot. 2. Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. 3. Simmer until the vegetables are tender. 4. Season with salt, pepper, and herbs to taste. 5. Serve hot as a comforting and nutritious soup.

1. Cook tortellini in boiling chicken broth until al dente. 2. Remove from heat and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. 3. Add chopped fresh parsley and black pepper for added flavor. 4. Serve hot in a bowl with some of the broth.

1. Boil potatoes until tender, then peel and mash them. 2. Mix mashed potatoes, flour, and egg to form a dough. 3. Roll the dough into long ropes and cut them into small pieces. 4. Cook the gnocchi in boiling water until they float to the surface. 5. Drain the gnocchi and toss them with tomato sauce. 6. Place the gnocchi in a baking dish, top with mozzarella cheese, and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly. 7. Serve hot.

1. Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into thick slices. 2. Arrange them on a plate, alternating between tomato and mozzarella slices. 3. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices. 4. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. 5. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 6. Serve as a refreshing and colorful salad.

1. Mix flour, sugar, and butter to form a dough. 2. Roll out the dough and cut it into circles. 3. Wrap each circle of dough around a metal cannoli tube. 4. Fry the cannoli shells until golden and crisp. 5. Let the shells cool and remove the tubes. 6. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese and chocolate chips. 7. Fill the cannoli shells with the ricotta mixture. 8. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.

1. Brown veal shanks in a pan. 2. Sauté chopped onion, carrots, and celery. 3. Add tomato paste and cook for a few minutes. 4. Place veal shanks and vegetable mixture in a pot. 5. Add enough broth to cover the meat. 6. Simmer on low heat for several hours until the meat is tender. 7. Serve with gremolata and risotto or polenta.

1. Mix breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, and chopped parsley. 2. Place a spoonful of the breadcrumb mixture on a slice of beef. 3. Roll up the beef tightly and secure with toothpicks. 4. Brown the braciole in a pan on all sides. 5. Add tomato sauce and simmer until the beef is cooked through. 6. Serve with pasta or mashed potatoes.

1. Cook cannelloni shells according to package instructions. 2. Brown ground meat in a pan and add chopped spinach. 3. In a bowl, mix the cooked meat mixture with ricotta cheese. 4. Stuff the cannelloni shells with the meat and cheese mixture. 5. Place the stuffed shells in a baking dish and pour bechamel sauce over them. 6. Bake in the oven at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes or until the top is golden. 7. Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
